plugins.name: Cya CDN
plugins.description:
Cya CDN


Cya CDN is a Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of uploading selected nodes to a CDN or Cloud Server and retrieving the corresponding remote URL. When a node is successfully uploaded, the plugin automatically caches the CDN URL within the node, allowing anyone with access to the Figma file to easily retrieve and share the URL.


I provided an API example at github, you can fork this repo and run it at local to upload assets!


Github: cya-cdn-upload-server


Before you can use this plugin, you need to provide some configuration in the plugin setting page, the configuration is listed below:


1. TinyPNG API Key

2. CDN Prefix Path

3. CDN Upload URL

4. Image Scale


TinyPNG API Key


If you want to compress the image before upload, you should provide the TinyPNG API Key, you can get the key in the TinyPNG official website: https://tinypng.com/developers


CDN Prefix Path


This parameter is the prefix path of your CDN server, CDN Prefix Path is optional.


CDN Upload URL


You must provide the CDN upload URL, the plugin will upload the image to this URL, the URL should be like this: `https://cdn.example.com/upload`, the plugin will send a POST request to this URL, the request body is a form data, the keys is:


* file: file blob the plugin generated

* tinyAPIKey: from plugin settings

* cdnPrefixPath: from plugin settings


Example of the CDN Upload URL request:

POST https://cdn.example.com/upload

file: binaray
cdnPrefixPath: temp
tinyApiKey: Qbh0C9QSM2Z0ftBjyhydYb6sF******

# Response 
{
  "cdnUrl": "https://cdn.example.com/temp/bca484f1-7798-4b63-946a-****"
}


Example of the CDN Upload backend implementation(NextJs API):

import { NextApiHandler } from "next";
import formidable, { File } from "formidable";
import tinify from "tinify";
import fs from "fs";
import path from "path";
import OSS from "ali-oss";

export const config = {
  api: {
    bodyParser: false,
  },
};

type ApiFormData = {
  file: File;
  cdnPrefixPath?: string;
  tinyApiKey?: string;
};

const compressImage = async (file: File, tinyApiKey: string) => {
  tinify.key = tinyApiKey;
  const source = tinify.fromFile(file.filepath);
  await source.toFile(file.filepath);
};

const uploadImage = async (file: File, prefixPath: string) => {
  const client = new OSS({
    bucket: "xxx...",
    region: "xxx...",
    accessKeyId: "xxx...",
    accessKeySecret: "xxx...",
  });
  const result = await client.put(
    path.join(prefixPath, file.newFilename),
    file.filepath
  );
  return result.url;
};

const compressAndUpload: NextApiHandler = async (req, res) => {
  console.log("handle compress and upload request");
  const form = formidable({
    encoding: "utf-8",
  });
  const [fields, files] = await form.parse(req);
  const file = (files.file as File[])[0];
  const cdnPrefixPath = fields.cdnPrefixPath[0];
  const tinyApiKey = fields.tinyApiKey[0];
  console.log(file, cdnPrefixPath, tinyApiKey);
  if (tinyApiKey) {
    await compressImage(file, tinyApiKey);
  }
  const cdnUrl = await uploadImage(file, cdnPrefixPath || "");
  console.log(cdnUrl);
  fs.unlinkSync(file.filepath);
  return res.status(200).json({ cdnUrl });
};

export default compressAndUpload;


Tips: if you want to use this plugin, you must implement the backend API first, and then provide the API URL to the plugin.


Image Scale


Which scale you want to upload, the default value is 2x.


About the local cache


1. The plugin will cache the profile settings in local, so you don't need to provide the profile settings every time you use the plugin.

2. If the node is uploaded before, the plugin will not upload it again, it will use the cached url.


If you have any questions, please contact me: lvchenyang@baicizhan.com
plugins.tagline: Compress selected node by tinypng.com to PNG and upload it to Cloud Server.

plugins.name: Follow the Path
plugins.description:
🧭 FOLLOW THE PATH

A Figma plugin that automatically arranges objects along a vector path with customizable spacing and orientation options.


🎯 FEATURES


🧩 Simple Path Selection

  1. Select any vector path to use as a guide for object placement.


🧱 Multiple Object Support

  1. Arrange one or many objects along your selected path.


🧠 Auto-Detection

  1. The plugin automatically detects both path and objects in your selection.


📏 Flexible Spacing

  1. Auto interval: Distributes objects evenly along the path
  2. Manual interval: Set exact pixel spacing between objects


⚙️ Advanced Controls

  1. Rotate objects to follow the path's direction
  2. Measure from center of objects (optional)
  3. Align objects to start, center, or end of path


🧑‍💻 HOW TO USE


  1. Select a vector path, or select both the path and objects
  2. Configure spacing and alignment preferences
  3. Click “Distribute” to apply


🔬 TECHNICAL DETAILS

  1. Works with any valid vector path
  2. Optimized for performance with large selections
  3. Smart algorithm for precise placement


🚧 BETA NOTICE & KNOWN ISSUES

This is a beta version. Feedback is welcome — future updates may follow based on interest and available time.


⚠️ Known issue:

Native Figma shapes (such as ellipses, stars, and polygons) may incorrectly define the starting point of the path after being edited or used in boolean operations. This can lead to inaccurate object placement.


✅ How to fix:

Copy the shape as SVG and paste it back into the canvas — this will convert it into a clean vector path.

Additionally, you can manually inspect and adjust the nodes if needed.
plugins.tagline: Arrange objects along any vector path with flexible spacing and rotation options.

plugins.name: Token Mapper
plugins.description:
Token Mapper is a utility plugin that maps Figma styles to WinUI Resources for the Windows UI 3 Kit.


To start the plugin, right click anywhere on the canvas and choose "Token Mapper" from the Plugins menu. A keyboard shortcut to run the plugin is also available by pressing Ctrl + / and then typing in "Token Mapper".


Instructions:

  1. Run the Token Mapper plugin
  2. Make a selection of a WinUI 3 kit component
  3. Click on a token in the plugin to copy it to the clipboard


Tip: To "deep select" nested elements when making a selection, hold down the Ctrl key on your keyboard and then click the left mouse button.


Tip: Also, you can "walk" the selection up and down the parent-child layer tree by pressing the Shift + Enter keys or by pressing the Enter key respectively. Pressing Enter after making a selection, will "drill down" and select the nested elements if any exist.
plugins.tagline: Inspect and copy the Fluent Windows tokens used in a design

plugins.name: TypeWise Studio - FInd & Export Font Styles
plugins.description:
TypeWise Studio is here to make typography management in Figma easy and efficient. If you’re tired of digging through layers to find fonts, weights, and sizes, this tool will help you quickly identify and organize all your text styles. Whether you're working solo or in a large team, TypeWise Studio helps you maintain consistency across your designs with minimal effort.


Key Features:


  1. Identify All Font Styles in Your File: Instantly view all fonts, weights, sizes, and and how many times each style is used.
  2. One-Click Style Selection: Select all instances of a font style across your Figma file with a single click. No more hunting down individual layers!
  3. Export a Typography Document: Generate a clean, organized typography document that showcases all your named styles with sample text for easy reference.
  4. Create and Link Figma Styles: With a single click, automatically create Figma styles and link all your text layers to their respective styles for better consistency.
  5. Organize Your Fonts by Usage: Sort and track your fonts based on their frequency of use, making it easier to streamline your typography choices.


Why Use TypeWise Studio? 

Keep your typography workflow efficient, organized, and consistent. Whether you’re building a style guide, preparing a design for handoff, or just cleaning up a messy file, TypeWise Studio makes managing fonts in Figma easier than ever.
plugins.tagline: The Ultimate Typography Manager for Figma

plugins.name: HCT Palette
plugins.description:
Create accessible color palettes for your design system in no time, with the help of HCT, a perceptual uniform color space.


How to Use:

  1. Input Your Base Color: Enter a color in HEX, RGB, or HSL format, and the plugin will automatically generate the corresponding HCT color.
  2. Name Your Palette: Give your palette a descriptive name such as “primary,” “success,” or “danger.”
  3. Customize Tones: The tool generates tones from 0 to 100 by default, in increments of 10. To add custom tones, simply input the desired value and press enter.
  4. Remove Tones: Hover over any tone and click the “X” to remove it from the palette.
  5. Add to Canvas: Click the "Add to Canvas" button to place the color palette directly onto your Figma canvas.
  6. Add to Variables: Click the "Add to Variables" button to add the colors palette as Figma's variables.


Check out the article Building an Accessible Color System to learn more about creating and refining color palettes, and building an accessible color system out of it.


HCT Color Space:

HCT (Hue, Chroma, Tone) is a perceptually uniform color space developed by Google. It combines the CAM16 model for hue and chroma with the CIELAB (D65) color space's tone (lightness), ensuring consistent visual representation across hues. By converting complex contrast ratios into simple tonal differences, HCT makes it easy to meet accessibility standards—just select colors with enough tonal contrast!


Explore More on HCT:

  1. The Science Behind HCT and Color Design
  2. Handbook of Color Psychology
plugins.tagline: Generate accessible color palettes instantly with HCT color space.

plugins.name: Zen Keys
plugins.description:
Zen Keys is a plugin that extends the Quick Actions menu to provide more keyboard accessibility for Figma features that don't have dedicated shortcuts. Spend less time reaching for your mouse and lean into Figma zen mode with keyboard actions:

  1. Make: Create shapes, set size, and fill
  2. Style: Set fill, stroke, corner radius of objects
  3. Resize: Resize objects
  4. Auto Layout: set the auto layout direction of a frame
  5. Go To: Quickly navigate the canvas
  6. Variables: Copy and paste variables or collections between files including all dependent aliases and collections. Refactor variables quickly by replacing all instances with another variable and marking the original as deprecated or deleting it entirely.
plugins.tagline: Extended quick actions and tools for managing variables/collections

plugins.name: Primitive & Semantic colors Generator
plugins.description:
Color System Generator

Create, manage, and document comprehensive color systems with ease. Perfect for design systems, brand guidelines, and maintaining color consistency across projects.


Key Features:

  1. Smart Color Generation: Automatically generate harmonious color scales from a single primary color
  2. Dark Mode Support: Create and sync dark mode variants with one click
  3. Semantic Color System: Build semantic color tokens (primary, secondary, neutral, etc.) mapped to your base colors
  4. Live Preview: See your color system in action with an interactive UI mockup
  5. Documentation Export: Generate beautiful, comprehensive color documentation directly in Figma
  6. Multiple Export Formats: Export your color system as CSS variables, SCSS, or JSON
  7. Preset Libraries: Quick-start with popular color systems like Material Design, Apple Design, and Tailwind


Perfect for:

  1. Design System Teams
  2. UI/UX Designers
  3. Brand Designers
  4. Frontend Developers
  5. Design Ops


How It Works:

  1. Choose a primary color
  2. Adjust tint/shade generation settings
  3. Enable dark mode if needed
  4. add semantic color mapping


Preview in real-time

Generate variables and documentation

Create professional color systems in minutes instead of hours. Maintain consistency across your design system while ensuring accessibility and visual harmony.

plugins.name: Layer Renamer
plugins.description:
Hello, I am a designer. In my work, I often need to rename different product components with specified product numbers. Manually doing this is a massive task, so I used AI to develop this plugin (I have no coding skills). You can input multiple names directly into the plugin's input field or copy multiple names from Excel or other text tools and paste them into the input field. Names should be separated by spaces. This allows you to batch rename the selected layers in order.


How to Use:

· Open the plugin in Figma.

· Enter or paste the desired layer names in the input field.

· Select the layers you want to rename in Figma.

· Click the "Rename Layers" button to apply the new names.


Limitations:

· Ensure the number of names matches the number of selected layers to avoid naming errors.

· The renaming order follows the layer hierarchy from bottom to top.

· The plugin automatically removes special characters not supported in Windows file names during renaming.

· Save your work before batch renaming to prevent any unintended changes.
plugins.tagline: Rename selected layers using input names to boost workflow efficiency

91045.name: Layer Renamer
91045.description:
Hello, I am a designer. In my work, I often need to rename different product components with specified product numbers. Manually doing this is a massive task, so I used AI to develop this plugin (I have no coding skills). You can input multiple names directly into the plugin's input field or copy multiple names from Excel or other text tools and paste them into the input field. Names should be separated by spaces. This allows you to batch rename the selected layers in order.


How to Use:

· Open the plugin in Figma.

· Enter or paste the desired layer names in the input field.

· Select the layers you want to rename in Figma.

· Click the "Rename Layers" button to apply the new names.


Limitations:

· Ensure the number of names matches the number of selected layers to avoid naming errors.

· The renaming order follows the layer hierarchy from bottom to top.

· The plugin automatically removes special characters not supported in Windows file names during renaming.

· Save your work before batch renaming to prevent any unintended changes.
91045.tagline: Rename selected layers using input names to boost workflow efficiency

plugins.name: Palette lap
plugins.description:
[From.Red]

This Figma plugin leverages OKLCH and APCA color system to automatically generate color palettes for your designs. Take the guesswork out of color coordination and easily get professional, theory-based palettes.


Usage:

  1. Set the Hue - not just red, any hue can be used
  2. Adjust Chroma - 0.5 is max saturation, try 0.01 for muted neutrals
  3. Name the color Variables with custom token names


Result:

  1. Generate 0/1/2/3...97/98/99/100 levels
  2. Generate variables, like "palette/hero/50"
plugins.tagline: Generate Harmonious Color Palettes  based on OKLCH and APCA.

plugins.name: Layers (Jio DS)
plugins.description:
Requirements

It needs login enabled to Jio Design System Platform (DSP).


Features

🎨 Themeable Components

Instantly generate components that adapt to different themes, styles, and design tokens.

⚙️ Full Prop Control

Access and customize every component property—padding, color, typography, layout, and more.

🌗 Mode Switching

Easily toggle between light, dark, or custom modes to preview and apply different UI states.

📐 Frame Creation

Generate frames and layouts with consistent token application for seamless design system integration.

🧩 Token-Based Styling

Apply design tokens directly to components, ensuring visual consistency and scalability across your project.

🛠 Live Customization

See real-time changes as you adjust themes, tokens, and props—no need to manually restyle elements.

🧠 Smart Data Handling

Dynamic data binding for efficient style updates and easy theme switching without losing structure


How does it work?

It utilises style libraries from color palette & tokens to generate the themes. It has caching mechanism to improve how themes are applied to your designs.

Although this is blazingly fast, it is still advisable to apply a new theme on a selection and not on page for large files. Large files already consume a lot of resources and in turn slows down any change on it.


Need Help?

If you are having trouble applying theme to your designs, please write to dshelp@jio.com
plugins.tagline: Dynamic design system for Jio

plugins.name: Copy text with HTML tags
plugins.description:
How to get started?

Open the plugin and select a text box in your Figma file. Then, watch the text in the plugin window transform into semantically tagged text ready to be copied into your code editor.


Multiple styles supported

Currently the plugin supports bold, italic and underlined text styles. Note: Font weights such as SemiBold and Black will not be picked up as bold by this plugin. 


Plus... line breaks

There is also the ability replace line breaks with the <br> tag.


Only use the tags right for your project

You have the ability to customise your experience - simply select ‘Show options’ and select/deselect the formatting conditions appropriate for your project.


New addition - Color!

You can now get the in-line styling for text colors. Note that this segment of text will be added to a span, and the most common color in the selection will not be considered 'special' and therefore will be ignored.


New addition - Links!

Links will now be surfaced through this plugin, using <a href=""> syntax.


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

☕️ If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
plugins.tagline: Easily transform Figma text into plug-and-play styled text for your next project's code base

plugins.name: Team Pando
plugins.description:
Team Pando automatically creates user flows from your product requirements. Use our Figma plugin to sync your Figma designs with every step of your Team Pando user flows.


  • You’ll never miss a step that needs designing. We’ll even import the relevant requirements into your Figma file for easy reference. No more flipping between tabs and chats, hoping you covered everything.
  • We link your designs, requirements, and flows so engineers have everything organized and at their fingertips, ready to build. No more wasting time directing teammates to the right designs.
  • We auto-generate Figma prototypes based on the user flows to show off your work.
  • Make sure everyone on the team has just what they need, just where they need it and link everyone’s work back to the most important thing: the product you’re building.


How to use:

  1. Make a free teampando.com account (don’t forget to invite the rest of your team - PMs, designers, and engineers!)
  2. Create a project, write your product requirements (or ping your PM!), and watch Team Pando turn them into a user flow.
  3. Open a Figma document and launch the Team Pando plugin.
  4. Choose the project and flow you want to work on and tap “Sync”.
  5. You’ll see a Figma frame for every step in your flow, with the relevant requirements just beneath it.
  6. Design each step as you normally would.
  7. When you’re ready, select the element in each frame that should trigger a transition (e.g. buttons) and link it to the relevant transition from your flow.
  8. Check out your auto-generated prototype and enjoy the chorus of “thank yous” from the engineers you’re working with.


We’re excited to help in any way we can. Send a message to support@teampando.com for instant help any time.

accepted.name: Team Pando
accepted.description: Team Pando is your team's collaborative space for product requirements. We turn requirements into flows & align your whole team with the product you're building

plugins.tagline: A collaborative space for product requirements, linking designs to user flows for seamless teamwork

plugins.name: BrowserStack Accessibility Design Toolkit
plugins.description:
Prevent up to 40% of accessibility issues at the design stage.


BrowserStack Accessibility Design Toolkit is a powerful Figma plugin that helps design teams create accessible products from day one. With automated checks, intelligent suggestions, and component-level scanning, teams can shift-left to ensure accessibility compliance while designing, thus reducing development costs.


Learn more about Accessibility Design Toolkit here


Design Accessible Components


Start with Component Scanner to Bake Accessibility into Your Design System

The Accessibility Design Toolkit plugin scans component variants to help designers embed accessibility from the start. It provides:


  1. A component checklist of mandatory WCAG guidelines
  2. Detection of component states (hover, focus, disabled, etc.)
  3. Best practice guidelines for each component


By baking accessibility into your component library, you can scale accessibility consistently across your design system.


Issue Detection by Spectra™ Rule Engine


Automated, intelligent accessibility insights—built into your workflow


The Spectra™ Rule Engine powers deep accessibility checks across your website and mobile interfaces. Here’s what it automatically detects and guides you on:


  1. Contrast: Flags insufficient text-background contrast and issues caused by opacity
  2. Headings: Suggests proper heading hierarchy and flags structural issues like multiple H1s
  3. Focus Order: Recommends logical keyboard navigation flow for focusable elements
  4. Image Alt-text: Detects all image assets and checks if alt-text is provided
  5. Landmark: Identifies and suggests usage of semantic landmarks for improved navigation
  6. Touch Target Size: Detects tap targets that fail to meet accessibility size and spacing standards
  7. Vision Simulator: Previews visual experiences for users with impairments such as color blindness


Simplify Design-to-Developer Handoff


As part of both component scanner and layout scanner, the plugin auto-generates guidelines and documentation to streamline handoffs:


  1. Automatic heading and text detection for simplified annotations
  2. Intelligent focus order suggestions to skip manual tagging
  3. Accurate ARIA label recommendations and design specs


---

This plugin is licensed under Figma’s Terms of Service, unless you have a different agreement with us for Figma Services, and any use of BrowserStack Services is subject to your agreement with BrowserStack.
plugins.tagline: Digital accessibility co-pilot for designers

- Intuitive and user-friendly interface.

plugins.name: Wordsvil - The Text Management System
plugins.description:
Wordsvil.com is made to help you and your team to organize, translate and update all text in your app and across different departments. Keep everyone on the same page.


  • Upload your text file (.csv, .json), or create it directly from your Figma file
  • Invite team members to join you in Figma or on the webapp to work with you
  • Update and sync your files through the plugin or webapp, add new languages, ensure everyone is on the same page. 
  • Export for end-products in .csv and .json. (directly API coming soon) 


How it works: 

Wordsvil.com connects your Figma text objects with your apps text files. The Figma object name will be synced with the text keys, to keep both text values the same.


  • Install the plugin, or log into the website and set up an account
  • Add a new project and use “from Figma page” if you want to start from your Figma files, or utilize the other option to start from scratch, from csv or json files. 
  • After the project is created, the plugin/webapp serves as the source of truth. 
  • Within the project, click on the menu and select Team to add collaborators to a project.


For csv follow this format. Example: 

key,notes,en,de 
welcome,,Welcome!,Willkommen!


For json follow this format. Example: 

{ "EN": { "welcome": "Welcome!",  “buy”: ”Buy now” },
  "DE": { "welcome": "Willkommen!", “buy”: ”Kauen”  }}


keywords/tags

copy, content, text, strings, writing, localization, language, translation, words, sync, translate

plugins.name: Calendar Date Updater
plugins.description:
You no longer need to manually update at least 7x5=35 date instances!

Update your calendar to the desired month, year, and selected date easily.


Features:

  1. Instantly update all dates without manually editing each one.
  2. Automatically reflect each styles such as "today" and "selected date."
  3. Fully supports calendars that include ISO Week.


Calendar instances must meet the following conditions:

  1. Each date element must be an same Instance where Properties can be configured.
  2. Dates belonging to the same week must be grouped into a single row.
  3. All calendar text must be written in English. Arbitrary text values are not allowed.


For more detailed instructions and guides, please refer to this document! This also serves as a playground where you can test the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Update your calendar to today — even mark “Today”!

plugins.name: 쉽게 UX Writing Editor
plugins.description:
Write easy to use EasyUX - Makes it easy to create UX writing

It is possible to create UX Writing easily based on mass words data in business even personal.


Features

  1. Elaborating your sentences with given “alternative expressions”, correct spelling and proper grammar depending on your own massive data,
  2. Polishing sentences based on your business specific data.
  3. Changing literal style with 5 types.
  4. Creating a paragraph just giving 3 keywords


Learn more detail about the EasyUX features at https://twominutes.co.kr

To use tutorial versions of EasyUX, visit https://www.easyux.kr/


쉽게 - 쓰는 경험, 읽는 경험을 모두 쉽게 만들어 주는 UX라이팅 에디터

쉽게는 기업이 고객 대상으로 일관성있는 글쓰기를 하도록 돕는 데이터 기반 프로그램입니다.


기능

  1. '금지어'를 설정하고 '대체어'를 추천해 100명이 써도 한 명이 쓴 것처럼 회사의 글쓰기를 일관성있게 검토해요.
  2. 문장을 회사별 데이터를 기반으로 한 번에 다듬어요.
  3. 동일한 문장을 상황에 따라 5가지 톤앤매너로 바꿀 수 있어요.
  4. 키워드 3개만 쓰면 마케팅 문구 초안을 작성해요.


위에서 설명한 기능을 써 볼 수 있어요.https://www.easyux.kr/

UX라이팅 에디터 '쉽게'가 궁금하다면 https://twominutes.co.kr 방문해 보세요.

plugins.name: Ad Lib(s)
plugins.description:
Find out if your library components are used, in a list of design files.


1. How does it work? 


  1. First, go to your Figma settings and get a personal access token (aka a key which enables you, and only you, to communicate with your files),
  2. Then, copy / paste the links of both the library and the design files you want to inspect (those are the same links you use when your share a file, using the "Share" button)
  3. After a while, you should then see a list of all instances found in your design file, which components are used, and which aren't. You can click on a component, in order to locate it in your library file (to do so, you must launch this plugin in your library file)


2. Notes 


  • Please note that your personal token won't be shared or used in any way.
  • This plugin doesn't modify anything in your design (it only inspects, nothing more)
  • You need to be a least a member of a Team, otherwise you can't really use librairies, and this plugin won't be useful
  • All the files you can inspect must be created by you, or come from a Team you're a member of
  • The bigger the files, the longer you'll have to wait ! So, please be patient sometimes :)


If you find bugs, possible improvements, please feel free to contact me.
